messages.content: ComfyUI Workflow Encrypt is an extension that enables you to encrypt your workflow and share it with a key.

You can install ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt by going to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory in your terminal, typing 'git clone https://github.com/jtydhr88/ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt', and then restarting ComfyUI.
How do I use ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt to encrypt a workflow?

To encrypt a workflow, you first need to build your workflow, then click the Save(Encrypted) button. The encrypted key will appear on your browser and ComfyUI server console. Ensure to store the key as it will only be shown once. The browser will download an encrypted file instead of a viewable JSON file.
How do I use ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt to decrypt a workflow?

To decrypt a workflow, you need to share the encrypted file along with the key to others. They should install the extension, restart ComfyUI, click the Load(Decrypted) button, paste the key into the prompt, choose the encrypted file. If the key matches the file, ComfyUI should load the workflow correctly, otherwise it will fail.
To uninstall ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt, you need to delete the following two locations: 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt' and 'ComfyUI/web/extensions/comfyui-workflow-encrypt'.
What is used to implement the backend of ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt?
Cryptography is used to implement the backend of ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt.
Who is the author of ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt?
The author of ComfyUI-Workflow-Encrypt is credited as ComfyUI/ComfyUI.
